content.description: Up steep featured face, crack, and upper slab to bolted rap anchor.
content.location: First route on the tall main inside face of the cove.  Located to climber's right of Gutterball.

content.description: This route lies on a small pillar opposite Gutterball, Brainstem, etc... Start off a boulder and pull a slabby crux move onto the formation. A rising traverse leftward leads to a ledge and anchors
content.location: Start off a boulder on the right side of the Cove

content.description: Steep face on a protruding column at the mouth of The Cove, on its left side when walking in.
content.location: The protruding column is located to climber's left and around from the longer bolted Roundabout on the main face inside The Cove.

content.description: Steep slab start to connect to a left-slanting shallow flare crack to the top.  No supplemental trad gear necessary.
content.location: Right next to the road at the south tip of the sprawling formation that harbours Saddle Corridor on its westside and The Cove on the eastside.  Route faces the passing dirt road.

content.description: This route faces east and climbs a detached pillar left of  Up Your Alley.. Start up a slab and pull tricky balance moves up and left past 3 bolts  and into a wide crack. Jam and lie back the crack,, then move right onto a slab. Climb the slab up and left past a couple more bolts and into a hand-sized crack. Jam the crack, then clip one more bolt and then the anchors. An epic pitch!
content.location: East facing pillar with the wide crack in the middle seen on the left when approaching Brain Stem

content.description: One of the most epic pitches in the entire Apple Valley area!   This pitch climbs 130 ft. of sustained slab and knobs and may require two ropes to descend. Start up a slabby corner and continue up over bulges and knobs past 12 bolts on this seemingly endless pitch.
content.location: Located to climber's right of Up Your Alley, where the alcove gap gets tight.
